definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: The atmosphere will be filled with light music that would only serve as background as people converse with each other.
sentences.chinese: 人們彼此交談時，周圍瀰漫着作爲背景的輕音樂。

sentences.english: At my age, I need some soft music and small talk.
sentences.chinese: 我這個年齡，更需要的是輕音樂和彼此的語言溝通。

sentences.english: And I always listen some light music before go to bed for having a good sleep.
sentences.chinese: 睡覺前會來點輕音樂這樣會睡個好覺。

sentences.english: Dim the lights, play some soft music, maybe light some candles.
sentences.chinese: 將燈光調暗，放些輕音樂，也可以點上幾根蠟燭。

sentences.english: I would suggest listening to soft music.
sentences.chinese: 我建議你多聽聽輕音樂。

sentences.english: I like to listen to soft music before I go to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡在睡覺前聽輕音樂。

sentences.english: I suggest that there be some soft music to help us relax.
sentences.chinese: 我建議能夠放一些輕音樂來幫助學生放鬆心情。

sentences.english: When put all these photos in order, I often listen to light music to take my mind off.
sentences.chinese: 整理這些照片時，我也常聽輕音樂來放鬆自己。

sentences.english: Alternatively, drink a cup of camomile tea or listen to some soothing music.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以喝一杯甘菊茶，或者聽點輕音樂。

sentences.english: In 1986, she founded Chinese light Music Group and served as head.
sentences.chinese: 1986年她創建中國輕音樂團並擔任團長。

sentences.english: The piece of light music me the happy hours we spent together.
sentences.chinese: 那支首輕音樂使我想起我們一起度過的幸福時光。

sentences.english: It was an updated version of easy listening and funk.
sentences.chinese: 那是一種輕音樂和放克的升級版本。

definition: hulusi, aka cucurbit flute (a kind of free reed wind instrument)
alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device
